CONTENT: Originator: AARON ELLIS Supv Contacted: Dan Nunsie Condition Description: Whilst performing 1BwOSR 3.3.2.8-640A, UNIT ONE ESFAS INSTRUMENTATION SLAVE RELAY SURVEILLANCE (TRAIN A TURBINE TRIP - K640), it was noted that ETS manifold pressure (1PT-EH038) was reading 7 psig vs the required >200 psig to <1500 psig band. OA Manifold pressure (1PT-EH037) is reading 1064 psig which is within its required band of >700 psig to <1250 psig. Attempts were made to secure/start an EH pump as well as tripping and relatching the turbine. During the turbine trip, 1PT-EH038 was noted to spike slightly to ~40 psig. This procedure is currently required for entry into Mode 3. Immediate actions taken: Notified Supervisor Wrote IR Recommended Actions: Investigate and Repair What activities, processes, or procedures were involved? Why did the condition happen? What are the consequences? Any procedural requirements impacted? Identify any adverse physical conditions: List of Knowledgeable individuals and people notified: Is this a repeat or similar condition? Initial Screening Questions: Equipment issue located in the vital area, protected area, or other owner controlled properties such as switchyards or Lake/River Screen House? Yes Procedure or process issues with the potential to affect compliance with TS or license conditions? No Potential reportability concerns, including Environmental issues? No Analysis or setpoint deficiencies that impact onsite or offsite dose or dose rates? No Nuclear safety issue? No Significant Industrial Safety Issue (ie; excluding First Aids, non-work related issues, PPE Issues, etc)? No Personnel injury requiring offsite medical attention? No Tampering, vandalism or malicious mischief? No Operable Basis: 1. Describe the degraded or non-conforming condition: Unit One Turbine ETS Manifold will not pressurize 2. Specify the SSC affected by the degraded or non-conforming condition: 1PT-EH038 3. Describe the effect or potential effect of the degraded or non-conforming condition on the affected SSC's ability to perform its safety function: No impact to safety function in present mode 4. Summarize why there is reasonable expectation of operability: Issue tracked for A1R24 mode 1 (LCO 3.3.2) mode change risk assessment per SR 3.0.4 & OCC issues list. Dequip 3.3.g entered for present mode. No past operability concerns. Reportable Basis: The Reportability Reference Manual decision trees were reviewed. No reportability requirements identified. Functional Basis: Reviewed by: RICHARD ROWE 05/03/2024 21:52:19 CDT Reviewer Comments: Shift review complete SOC Reviewed by: LEANNE K ZIMMERMAN 05/28/2024 09:04:56 CDT SOC Comments: (CAP) (5/6/24 LMP) Close to WO 05535191 from this IR. (5/8/24 LKZ) Per MRC, Return to SOC. The orifice and manifold were flushed. Gather additional information. (5/13/24 SOC) Close to the information provided and ATI. (5/16/24 LKZ) Per MRC, Return to SOC. Gather additional information from SMEs. Add details to the IR such that the OPEX is captured. Determine if procedural guidance can be updated with troubleshooter information. (5/20/24 PG) Email sent to DC and ZM for additional information. (5/21/24 PG) From the SME: The following actions were taken to clear the apparent obstruction in the EH manifold: 1.The Manifold was taken OOS and the inlet orifice was inspected and cleaned. Nothing abnormal was identified, and this was not successful, as the original improper indications returned when the turbine was relatched the next morning after the system was RTS'd. 2.A trouble shooter was developed to perform steps of MA-BR-772-217 (Solenoid cycling and manifold reset) and BwOP CX-15 (Dummy in EH pressure signal to allow manifold reset) to perform a high pressure flush of the manifold block by cycling one upstream solenoid valve with the remainder of the valves closed. A flowchart showing the desired BwOP CX-15 and MA-BR-772-217 steps for flushing solenoids has been developed and could be compiled into a BwOP procedure format if desired. Contact Dan Comisky if this is the preferred option. Close to the information provided and ATIs. (5/23/24 MRP) Per MRC, return to SOC. Evaluate assignees/work groups on the ATIs. MMD doesn't do the flush. (5/24/24 RB) Close to updated ATIs and information provided.

Per OP-AA-101-113-1001, this screens as a Station Clock level reset per Att , lines 1.b, 1.c, 4.b,. (05-08-24 RLS) From a review, this IR may be reportable (LER) in accordance with 10 CFR 50.73(a)(2)(iv)(A) for "Any event or condition that resulted in manual or automatic actuation of any of the systems listed in paragraph (a)(2)(iv)(B) of this section, ... " Specifically, for 1) 10 CFR 50. 73(a)(2)(iv)(B)(1) for the "Reactor protection system (RPS) including: reactor scram or reactor trip," and 2) 10 CFR 50. 73(a)(2)(iv)(B)(6) for the "PWR auxiliary or emergency feedwater system." - Per PI-AA-120 Attachment 2, Significance Level 2 coding to be applied. This will require an LER be submitted to NRC within 60 days of event, or 07-04-2024. - Perform risk versus uncertainty review to determine appropriate level of investigation, per PI-AA-120 Attachment 3. Per PI-AA-120 Attachment 3, strong consideration should be given to perform a full Root Cause Evaluation when the issue involves an LER. It is understood that currently it has been determined that a CAPE will be performed. - Further, per PI-AA-125-1001 and 1003 (for Root Causes and evaluations), it states that if "the issue is reportable to the NRC (i.e., License Event Report), ENSURE the following review is included: A. Actual safety consequence of the event and the reason why that conclusion was reached. B. Safety consequences of the event if it occurred during the design basis event(s) for that system (including the background that allows this conclusion to be reached; this may require input of the associated PRA risk.) C. Whether it is a Safety System function failure (include the reason for this conclusion; this may require input from the applicable System Engineers)." THEREFORE, if WGE is performed, the above information at a minimum is to be included. For reference on details, the 2018 LER written for a reactor trip is documented under IRs 4132550 and 4144070 and the root causes performed under the IRs. - Assign an LER-type ATI to A8901RA, BRWBS, due 60 days after the initiation of this event, or 07-04-24. Subject/Assignment Description to state "Submit LER to NRC. Closure to include pasting a copy of the approved LER in the In-Progress notes." - Assign ACIT-type ATI to A8901RA, BRWBS, to "Obtain PORC approval of LER" - with an initial due date of 06-20-24. - Recommend whatever investigation type is determined, that the due date for the investigation THROUGH MRC be no later than 06-13-24 to allow for time to draft LER and provide for (5/13/24 PG) Close to the Root Cause investigation, ATIs, and information provided. Reference IR 4773443 for additional actions. (5/16/24 LKZ) Per MRC, OR evaluate if IR 4773443 was referenced in the IRIS for this IR, and email MRC team with findings. (7/22/24 LKZ) Per MRC, Approved with Comments (7/31/24 LKZ) Per MRC, RCR Approved with Comments. (7/31/24 LKZ) Per MRC, IRIS Approved with Comments.

Originator: EDMUND GILLETTE Supv Contacted: Ken Ruitenberg Condition Description: Per ATI-4717753, vibration data is to be collected monthly on the 1TO09C (turbine oil vapor extractor fan) until repairs are made and vibration data is SAT. The fan, motor, and housing were replaced as a set during A1R24-WO-53227660-01. Task 05 directs CMO to collect vibration data during PMT. Data was collected on 5/3/2024 and SAT. However, to close my ATI, data was recollected on 5/14/2024 and is not sat. Position 1 Horizontal is at 0.468 in/sec and 2 Horizontal is at 0.407 in/sec. This is in the Fault range per MA-AA-716-230-1002, of >.400 in/sec. Review of the WO in EWP, the demister was pulled for inspection, nor replaced. The fan is currently sucking up oil through the demister and is now leaking out the shaft seal. Oil residues build up on the fan blades will increase vibrations. Vacuum reads -1 and procedure says -1 to -4H20 Immediate actions taken: Notified, U1, SDM, EDM, CMO Manager, obtained peer checks. Recommended Actions: 1.Ensure system operation has no abnormal conditions. 2.Operations to ready air horn. In Progress 3.CMO to continue vibration monitoring from quarterly to monthly. ATI-04717753-02. 4.Replace demister sooner rather than later. 5.Ensure a replacement is on hand. CID-0000244838 show none at Braidwood and one at Byron. What activities, processes, or procedures were involved? Why did the condition happen? What are the consequences? Any procedural requirements impacted? Operations has pre-staged the eductor and air hoses in the event 1TO09C fails. Shift review complete. Originator: DANIEL J COMISKY Supv Contacted: Mark Heitzkey Condition Description: 1) Create new BwOP EH-__/__ to deenergize and reenergize the _PA22J and _RD07J Ovation cabinets. 2) Draft copies of the new procedures will be provided to the Ops Procedure Group. 3) These new procedures are a result of previous outage lessons learned. 4) These new procedures are unique to the _PA22J and _RD07J Ovation cabinets. All other Ovation cabinets have existing procedures for similar activities. 5) No ECR is required to support these new procedures. 6) It would be preferable to have these procedures in place for the A2R24 refueling outage.
